title: Meta layoffs, a setback for Mark Zuckerberg
description: The parent company of Facebook, which is losing momentum and whose strategy is struggling to gain acceptance, is laying off 11,000 employees.

title: In India, one climate disaster every day
description: The subcontinent is among the most vulnerable regions on earth to global warming. According to a study by the Center for Science and Environment, 241 of the first 273 days of the year were marked by an extreme weather event.

title: Biden hails 'good day for democracy' as Republican wave flounders
description: US president Joe Biden said Wednesday he was prepared to work with the opposition, after a surprisingly strong performance in midterm elections with Republicans inching toward a slim majority in only one chamber of Congress.

title: Musk 'kills' new Twitter label hours after launch, seeks to reassure advertisers
description: Just hours after going live, Elon Musk 'killed' Twitter's 'official' gray checks. They were meant to be Twitter's way of identifying legitimate accounts like media outlets and politicians.

title: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever': In Wakanda, it is time for mourning and superheroines
description: After the 2020 death of its star actor Chadwick Boseman, the Black Panther of the first film, the African kingdom must face a new threat from the ocean.

title: Deschamps names doubtful Varane and in-form Giroud to French World Cup squad
description: France's coach named 25 players to World Cup squad headed to Qatar in less than two weeks.

title: US midterms: Key US Senate race in Georgia goes to December runoff
description: Senator Raphael Warnock, Democrat, and Herschel Walker, Republican, will continue their race into a December runoff election as neither candidate earned the majority of votes needed by law to win outright.

title: Tropical Storm Nicole forces evacuations in Bahamas, Florida
description: Tropical Storm Nicole is expected to strike as a hurricane overnight in Florida, including some places that are still feeling the effects of Hurricane Ian.

title: Flood-hit Pakistan seeks climate damage compensation
description: The floods that devastated Pakistan during the summer marked a turning point in public opinion regarding financial support from industrial countries. The country has since become the focus of the debate on loss and damage at COP27.

title: French firm Vinci charged over alleged Qatar labor abuses
description: A French judge is set to probe the Vinci construction company over allegations it violated the rights of migrant workers in Qatar.

title: At COP27, the battle for a fossil fuel non-proliferation treaty is underway
description: Tuvalu was the first country at COP27 to call for the treaty, which 100 Nobel Prize winners and the WHO have said is necessary to stop the expansion of coal, oil and gas.

title: France to put 13 on trial over alleged 2018 plot against Macron
description: Thirteen members of the group called the 'Barjols' (Crazies) are suspected of planning a violent attack on French President Emmanuel Macron in 2018.

title: Rossy de Palma at Paris Photo: 'Like all great geniuses, William Klein was a very simple man'
description: The Spanish artist, guest of honor at the Paris photo exhibition, tells of her meeting and admiration for the photographer William Klein, who died in September.

title: Macron offers biggest polluters a decarbonization deal
description: Banking on incentives rather than coercion, the French president promised to set aside a package of €10 billion for large French companies to reduce their CO₂ emissions.

title: Russia orders withdrawal from Kherson, key position in southern Ukraine
description: The city of Kherson was the only regional capital captured during Moscow's February 24 invasion, and has been a key target of an ongoing counter-offensive.

title: After ten years, France to end military operation Barkhane in Sahel
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday, November 7 that France was ending its anti-jihadist mission in Africa, with a new strategy to be worked out within the next half-year.

title: France and Italy quarrel over fate of humanitarian ship with 234 migrants
description: The boat has requested a safe port in France, as there was no solution for disembarking in Italy.

title: French Church under scrutiny as it tries to manage sexual abuse crisis
description: The president of the French bishops' conference, Eric de Moulins-Beaufort, acknowledged on Tuesday that he had been told of Cardinal Jean-Pierre Ricard's abuse of a 14-year-old girl as early as February.

title: NATO membership: Erdogan again postpones ratification of Swedish and Finnish applications
description: On a trip to Ankara on Tuesday, Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson gave the Turkish president certain guarantees, but they were not enough, according to some officials.

title: Macron says France, UK to hold defense summit in early 2023
description: The French president said the summit will strengthen military cooperation between the UK and France.

title: Midterm elections: Georgia is once again a decisive state for the Senate
description: In the absence of an absolute majority, the two candidates for senator could face each other in a run-off election in December.

title: Police raid French rugby World Cup HQ as corruption probe opened
description: Prosecutors confirmed for the first time that an investigation was opened for favoritism, corruption and influence-peddling at France-2023, the World Cup organizing committee.

title: French energy minister weakened by accusations of conflicts of interest
description: Investigative website Disclose revealed on Tuesday that Agnès Pannier-Runacher's children were stakeholders in a company whose funds are located in tax havens, with possible ties to an oil corporation.

title: US midterms: Uncertainty over Congress is a nasty surprise for Republicans
description: With Republicans still clinging to their goal of winning a majority in the House and even the Senate, the landscape emerging from the polls looks uncertain.

title: Facebook parent company Meta cuts 11,000 jobs
description: Meta announced it was laying off 13% off its workforce as a result of reduced revenue growth, at a time when a number of the tech giants are experiencing severe challenges.

title: Midterm elections: The two takeaways from America
description: The first results of the midterm elections show that the Democrats are doing better than expected and that the anticipated red wave has failed to materialize.

title: Sunak government experiences first turbulence with harassment allegations
description: Gavin Williamson, minister without portfolio, was forced to resign just a fortnight after taking office amid accusations of harassment.

title: Midterm elections: 'In the wake of Donald Trump, the Republican Party is content with piling on slogans'
description: The former president of the United States intends to use the result of the mid-term elections to run for president in 2024, writes columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Voter ID passes in Nebraska as states decide on new election measures ahead of 2024
description: Photo identification, an amendment prohibiting non-US citizens from voting and expanded access to early voting were among the electoral issues on ballots.

title: COP27: Burkina Faso uses improved methods to predict rainfall and extreme weather events
description: Burkina Faso, the pilot country of climate research in the Sahel under the ClimSA program, has been experiencing repeated droughts. It is working to strengthen weather information in a region where the means of observation are sorely lacking.

title: Ryanair puts the global pandemic behind it
description: The Irish low-cost airline recorded its biggest ever after-tax profit this summer.

title: US basketball star Griner gets transferred to Russian penal colony
description: The two-time Olympic gold medallist was arrested at a Moscow airport in February with vape cartridges containing cannabis oil, which is banned in Russia.

title: US midterms: Abortion rights protected in Michigan, California and Vermont
description: The election comes months after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade and the right to abortion it guaranteed, making reproductive rights a key issue for voters.

title: French transport strike looks set to severely disrupt Paris
description: Paris is preparing for a tumultuous day on Thursday with half of the city's Metro lines  closed completely, while the rest of the city's public transport network will see very heavy disruption.

title: US midterms: On election day, Trump remains focused on voter fraud
description: The former Republican president decried alleged voting anomalies on Tuesday, fuelling the idea of electoral fraud – as he has since he lost the 2020 presidential election.

title: COP27: Development banks must do more on climate
description: Accused of not facing up to the climate emergency, the World Bank has been called upon to change.

title: Midterm elections: Republicans in grinding push to break Democrats' hold on Congress
description: Republicans hoped for a wipeout, but the sweeping wins had yet to materialize early Wednesday. Meanwhile, the fate of Democrats narrow hold on the Senate was unclear.

title: Midterms elections: Ron DeSantis, contender for the Republican presidential nomination, wins in Florida
description: The Republican governor of the Sunshine State easily won by 20 points over his Democratic opponent. He has confirmed his position as the only credible alternative to Donald Trump within the Grand Old Party.

title: Midterm elections: Democrat Fetterman wins key Pennsylvania Senate race
description: Pennsylvania's lieutenant governor is giving Democrats hope they can retain control of the closely divided chamber.

title: Twitter reveals new 'official' label for select verified accounts
description: The social media giant says governments, companies, media outlets and public figures will get the new label, which is not for sale.

title: Midterm results: Abrams concedes to Kemp in Georgia governor rematch
description: The Democratic candidate was again beaten by her Republican rival, who clinched another term despite attacks from former President Donald Trump.

title: Trump-backed JD Vance wins key Ohio Senate Race
description: The best-selling 'Hillbilly Elegy' author backed by Donald Trump, won a contentious race for Ohio's open US Senate seat Tuesday, in a disappointment for Democratic President Joe Biden.

title: War in Ukraine: The balance of power between Russian and Ukrainian armies is shifting with winter's arrival
description: Frost and fog may slow down Ukrainian counter-offensives, but Kyiv's troops are better equipped than Moscow's to deal with the falling temperatures.

title: 'Assisted dying': French President Emmanuel Macron is trying to depoliticize the debate
description: Following his supportive statements on euthanasia, the president seems to be stalling for fear of dividing public opinion and his majority.

title: Midterm elections results: Trailblazers secure big wins
description: From the first openly lesbian governor to the first Generation Z member-elect of Congress, early results in the US midterms heralded a good night for diversity.

title: Sadek Hadjerès, figure of the Algerian left, dies at 94
description: The nationalist activist, a former executive of the Algerian Communist Party, died on November 3 in Paris, where he had been living in exile since 1990.

title: Midterm Results: Greg Abbott defeats Beto O'Rourke in Texas governor race
description: The Republican governor won a third term Tuesday, strengthening his position as a potential 2024 presidential contender and securing his place as the state’s second-longest serving governor.

title: 2022 Midterm elections: Inflation, democracy, Trump-Biden are on voters' minds
description: An AP VoteCast survey depicts a country in distress at a moment when control of Congress – and a choice between sharply contrasting visions of America – hang in the balance.

title: Why France and 51 other countries voted against the UN resolution condemning Nazism
description: For a decade, Russia has submitted a text denouncing the 'glorification of Nazism' at each session, but the resolution was particularly unpopular this year because of the war in Ukraine.

title: Maryland becomes 20th state to legalize marijuana
description: Four other states – Arkansas, Missouri, North Dakota, and South Dakota – are deciding on Election Day whether to approve recreational marijuana.

title: 10,000 fake health passes, €400,000 in receipts: A team of scammers appears before French court
description: Eleven people have been indicted in this case, which began in August 2021. A guilty plea procedure is due to be held on Wednesday for five of them.

title: Maura Healey becomes first openly lesbian US governor
description: The Democratic Attorney General defeated Trump backed Republican Geoff Diehl to become Massachusetts' first woman and openly gay govenor.

title: Days after taking control of Twitter, Elon Musk sells nearly $4 billion in Tesla stock
description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission documents show Musk, who financed much of his Twitter purchase with Tesla stock, sold more than 19 million shares.

title: Christie's could set record with Microsoft co-founder's $1 bn art collection
description: More than 150 masterpieces by the likes of Sandro Botticelli, Claude Monet and Vincent Van Gogh will be sold on November 9 and 10.

title: World Cup 2022: The time has come for French coach Deschamps to reveal his team
description: The list of players selected for the World Cup in Qatar will be unveiled on Wednesday evening on French television. From using Olivier Giroud to the doubts around Raphael Varane, a number of uncertainties still remain.

title: Midterm election results: Governors
description: Thirty-six states are electing governors, with many of those races also poised to come down to the slimmest of margins.

title: Midterm election results: Florida's Republican Governor Ron DeSantis reelected
description: The victory over Democrat Charlie Crist is bolstering his rise as a prominent GOP star with potential White House ambitions.

title: Midterm election results: Senate
description: The 2022 midterm election is underway and Le Monde has results for key Senate races across the country.

title: 2022 midterm election results in maps
description: US voters were called to the polls to elect the House of Representatives and one-third of the Senate. Here are the results in both chambers.
